syllabus:
**English for Science and Engineering (English III, College of Science & Engineering) Spring Semester, 2022**

**Instructor:**  
Dr. Ruei-Fang Shiang  
**Email:**   
[joyceshiang@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:joyceshiang@ntnu.edu.tw)  
  
Gong-Guan Campus: Monday, 13:20~ 15:10  
Main Campus: Thursdays, 10:20~12:10

**Office Hours:**  
By appointment to be arranged after class or by email. 

**Course Description (tentative):**

This course is mainly for science and engineering majors whose English language proficiency are at intermediate level at least and who are eager to improve their English language skills in science. In this course, students will develop their academic English competence and the breadth of vocabulary in science. Moreover, they are expected to construct and orally present content knowledge that is relevant to the pure and applied sciences through a variety of in- class and out-of-class activities. (課程設計以主修物理、工程領域的同學為主)

**Textbook:**

Instructor-selected authentic reading materials or Instructor-edited materials. 

**In this class, you will...** 

Do simple and fun experiments  
Read science magazines and journals   
Have group competitions and discussion  
Present your science projects

**Attendance Policies**

All absences will be classified as excused or unexcused. 

Absences for the following reasons will be _excused_ if there is timely verification (within 1 week) of such reasons provided to the instructor: 

\-Illness or medical emergency.  
\-Family emergencies  
\-Pre-arranged medical appointments.  
\-Pre-arranged school-sponsored activities, such as field trips. 

A Notification of Absence Form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統) within 1 week. Verification document (hard-copy) should also be handed in to the instructor within 1 week. Late submission will not be accepted. 

Students who are more than 20 minutes late to class will be considered absent. 

Students will fail this course if there are more than 3 unexcused absences. 

Students will fail this course if they miss more than 5 meetings the whole semester. 

**GRADING POLICIES** 

Each student must actively participate in all types of in-class and out-of-class activities, group projects, specifically, discussion! The grading criteria are listed below: 

Attendance 12% 

(1% will be given if students present on time and bring the weekly reading article to class. Using smartphone or laptop for inappropriate purposes will be treated as absence. Two such absences will result in failing of the course) 

Group presentation 10%  
Showcase Projects 10 %  
Participation 53% (whole class discussion, answering or asking question)   
Bonus Project 15%

More details will be updated on the course group page (or in class), be sure to  
visit it frequently!
